node.title: House Panel Investigating Capitol Attack Subpoenas Proud Boys and Oath Keepers
node.alt: Henry “Enrique” Tarrio, left, the chairman of the Proud Boys, was issued a subpoena for his involvement with the Capitol attack on Jan. 6.
node.description: Investigators believe the militia or paramilitary groups have information about the deadly siege on Jan. 6.
node.content: ["WASHINGTON \u2014 The House committee investigating the Capitol attack issued subpoenas on Tuesday to three militia or paramilitary groups, including the Proud Boys and the Oath Keepers, that investigators believe have information about the deadly siege on Jan. 6.", "The subpoenas were issued to the Proud Boys International, L.L.C., and its chairman Henry \u201cEnrique\u201d Tarrio; the Oath Keepers and its president Elmer Stewart Rhodes; and the 1st Amendment Praetorian and its chairman Robert Patrick Lewis.", "\u201cThe select committee is seeking information from individuals and organizations reportedly involved with planning the attack, with the violent mob that stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6 or with efforts to overturn the results of the election,\u201d Representative Bennie Thompson, Democrat of Mississippi and the chairman of the committee, said in a statement. \u201cWe believe the individuals and organizations we subpoenaed today have relevant information about how violence erupted at the Capitol and the preparation leading up to this violent attack.\u201d", "The committee said members of Proud Boys International called for violence before Jan. 6, and the Justice Department indicted at least 34 people affiliated with the group.", "People associated with the Oath Keepers were similarly involved in planning and participating in the Capitol riot, the committee said, including 18 members who were indicted by a federal grand jury for allegedly planning a coordinated attack to storm the building. Mr. Rhodes repeatedly suggested that the Oath Keepers should engage in violence to ensure their preferred election outcome. He was also allegedly in contact with several of the indicted Oath Keepers members before, during and after the Capitol attack, including meeting some of them outside the Capitol.", "1st Amendment Praetorian is an organization that provided security at multiple rallies leading up to Jan. 6 that amplified former President Donald J. Trump\u2019s false claims of a stolen election. The group\u2019s Twitter account suggested on Jan. 4 that violence was imminent, the committee said.", "\u201cToday is the day that true battles begin,\u201d Mr. Lewis wrote on Twitter on Jan. 6. He also claimed to be involved with \u201cwar-gaming\u201d to continue efforts to overturn the election results, the committee said.", "The panel has issued more than 40 subpoenas and interviewed more than 200 witnesses as it investigates the violence that engulfed Congress and delayed the formalization of President Biden\u2019s victory. The latest subpoenas demand records and testimony by mid-December."]
